Mother bear Vera showing signs of distress. Zoo seeks companion for cub, considers bringing in father to help Vera.
58b49fef1d6d2be5211848adc2882b59f043a933: Pastor Brady Boyd describes emotional meeting between parents of church shooter and victims' family. Meeting took place at New Life Church in Colorado Springs, where attack occurred. Shooter's parents thanked security guard for her swift action in stopping the attack. Pastor says meeting was "best for the Murrays" and helped with healing process.
bdcc1253f679b14e54451db44f4f0e39af4bb559: Over a dozen wildfires rage across Southern California, threatening thousands of structures and forcing mass evacuations. More than 265,000 people have been evacuated and nearly 4,900 firefighters are battling the blazes. The fires have consumed over 98,000 acres and destroyed or damaged at least 50 homes and businesses. Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger declares a state of emergency in seven counties and requests National Guard assistance.
b22b1636da5dd15364b6f0c342e4ce4903e51c2a: Glasgow derby between Celtic and Rangers postponed due to death of Motherwell captain Phil O'Donnell. Motherwell's game against Hibernian also called off. Gretna's match against St Mirren postponed as it was scheduled at Fir Park. Other three fixtures scheduled for Wednesday will go ahead.
55986d11e0d0e5b031567157cf1f157610c65c31:
Mobile courtrooms in India's rural areas address backlog of cases
Judge Sandeep Singh's mobile courtroom hears criminal and civil complaints
300 million unresolved cases in India could take over 300 years to clear
Mobile courts increase attendance of villagers and attorneys, improve efficiency
0a37124fe35e31ae9fe8dd7715aeed88002e23e9: President Bush's homeland security adviser, Fran Townsend, resigns after 4½ years. Townsend plans to pursue opportunities in the private sector, such as public speaking, writing, and global risk management. President Bush praises Townsend's work, stating that the country is safer due to her leadership. Townsend will be part of the search committee to find her replacement by the beginning of next year.
ef3ee3ab85ed8802b6b76444bccb46256077963e:
Chiquita faces $7.86 billion lawsuit filed by Colombian families
Families allege company responsible for "torture and murder" of loved ones
Chiquita admitted to making protection payments to terrorist organization AUC
Company denies allegations, says it will fight the lawsuit
fb17ac082bd3f3af3dad8c8d36d9ea56360c520e: 2-year-old Riley Ann Sawyers was beaten, held underwater, and thrown across the room before her death. Her body was found in a plastic storage box in Galveston waterway. Riley's mother, Kimberly Dawn Trenor, and her husband, Royce Zeigler, have been arrested on charges of injuring a child and tampering with evidence. Trenor admitted to the abuse and disposal of Riley's body in a voluntary statement to police.
59f079f6095cbb82b0eaaa0ba5fc29cdaff1f81b:
- Police defuse bomb in abandoned car in central London, find second car with similar contents nearby
- Four suicide bombers attack London's transport network, killing 52 and injuring around 700
- Anti-terrorist police disrupt plot by Islamic militants to blow up targets in southeast England
- Series of IRA bombings throughout the UK from the 1970s to the 1990s, targeting various locations
083bc4309f2ea52be2a378e78566d7dcc9f4dd73: Topps Meat Co. expands ground beef recall to 21.7 million pounds due to potential E. coli contamination. The recalled products have a "sell by date" or "best if used by date" between September 25, 2007, and September 25, 2008. 25 illnesses are under investigation across eight states. The company has shut down production in the ground beef area of its plant until investigations are complete.
ac56bd50e449bfa1d7b923415afa2ae5f7c83392:
Boy playing with matches started Southern California wildfire
38,000 acres scorched and 21 homes destroyed in Buckweed Fire
Juvenile suspect admitted to accidentally starting the fire
Case to be presented to Los Angeles County district attorney for possible charges
61e4747776bd844146a9b8c7c1913c827ffbcd8a: New CNN/Opinion Research Corp. poll shows a tight race between Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama in Texas. 50% of likely Democratic primary voters support Clinton, while 48% back Obama. The race is a virtual tie considering the poll's sampling error of plus or minus 4½ percentage points. Texas holds primaries on March 4.
a9854fc40719b0d083a3fd279b6196188228a4e0: At least 200 people evacuated after tanker truck carrying 9,000 gallons of gasoline erupted in northern Boston suburb. No serious injuries reported, but flames engulfed 40 cars and three buildings. Officials investigating whether driver was speeding. Firefighters still battling blaze in one home seven hours after initial explosion.
8d37ab9fcd0248c093f6d0e5682782ebdaf5e837:
Brazilian midfielder Kaka wins 2007 World Footballer of the Year award
AC Milan star recognized for his role in Champions League victory
Kaka's career has seen him score regularly for both club and country
Real Madrid expected to bid for Kaka if Milan fail to qualify for Champions League
d3199d123dedcdbae55b2e9d1f658717c1d5e233: Interpol makes global appeal to identify man in digitally reconstructed photos sexually abusing boys. Photos were on the Internet for years, but identity remains unknown. Photos taken in Vietnam and Cambodia. Interpol believes the man travels the world to exploit children.
f249ede5a3cafd2506ff2bb400291a7db1c43b76:
Up to 80,000 items at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library are unaccounted for due to poor record-keeping and inventory procedures.

An audit found "significant breakdown in internal controls" at the library, prompting the Reagan Foundation to urge the National Archives to fix the problems.

Library officials told auditors that their systems could only account for 20,000 items out of an estimated 100,000 items in the collection.

The audit examined management of artifacts at six presidential libraries, with particular issues
6343a202a70e8c5d3bfa4042bfd087d78ca5805e:
Dozens of Defense Department personnel actively fighting Southern California wildfires
12 Defense Department firefighting teams with 12 engines working the blazes
More than 17,000 National Guardsmen potentially available if needed
550 Marines from Camp Pendleton preparing to deploy to fire area
da0d41b431367b51fd995573cb498c10b7f64ca0: Tom Cruise discusses his beliefs in Scientology in a 2004 video that surfaced on the Internet this week. Cruise says he's "driven ... by the opportunity to really help, for the first time, change people's lives." The video was shown at a 2004 Scientology ceremony honoring Cruise for his humanitarian work. Church of Scientology officials said it can be viewed at any of its churches, but it created a stir this week when what the church calls a pirated and edited version appeared on YouTube
0620ff5fa324a35b4be54bbd2de49b42bdd0d7c0: Australia's new prime minister assures Afghan President Karzai of long-term commitment in Afghanistan. French President Sarkozy also pledges continued support during visit to Kabul. Australian Defense Minister warns of risks of losing war without changes in strategy. Over 1,900 French troops and nearly 1,000 Australian troops are currently in Afghanistan.
f0eb8f9eee266512eb604a51b482833e202531d8: Michael Vick turns himself in to authorities to begin serving his sentence for running a dogfighting ring. The Atlanta Falcons quarterback is scheduled to be sentenced on December 10 on a federal conspiracy charge. Vick faces 12 to 18 months in prison on the charge. Vick's attorney says he "wants to again apologize to everyone who has been hurt in this matter."
c8f743307d5d1f7f19f1474d68c9390b22f6d076: Pope Benedict XVI says football can teach moral lessons to young people. Italian football has been marred by corruption and match-fixing scandals. Pope endorses lower league club Ancona's campaign to promote fair play. Football should be a tool for teaching life's ethical and spiritual values.
5978abfdad91e604840a2dcc993df5ade9448e82: Two tractor-trailer trucks crashed and burst into flames on Pharr-Reynosa International Bridge, killing four people and injuring six others. The collision triggered a chain-reaction accident with three other vehicles. The bridge was closed for the rest of the evening and reopened on Friday morning after inspection.
5bcd4e61b39cc7ffff38ad88cd40afa208b18528: Pojamarn Shinawatra, wife of ousted Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra, arrived in Thailand to face corruption charges. She was presented with an arrest warrant at Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi International Airport and escorted to court. Shinawatra faces charges related to a Bangkok land deal and stock concealment, which could result in up to eight years in jail. She was released on 5 million baht bail and ordered not to leave the country.
44815c184e3013f07781311b30ec5ff009174738: Paris suburbs rocked by riots after two teens killed in collision with police car. Rioters clash with police, torch cars and buildings in Villiers-le-Bel. More than 60 police officers injured, five in serious condition. French president Nicolas Sarkozy calls for calm and letting justice system determine responsibility.
d7783bd2bf5ad92156962380342411c2eb068853:
Japanese actress Rinko Kikuchi, known for her Oscar-nominated role in "Babel," is now the face of Chanel.
Kikuchi remains an unconventional figure in Japan, forging a career on her own terms.
Talk Asia follows her on a modeling assignment and discusses her life since "Babel."
The show revisits the unique location of one of the film's most important scenes.
4963edb0ad2703e9f6c54593149d9b81e7ada91f:
Kenya's disputed election result leads to violence, deaths, and displacement
Economic concerns grow as businesses are destroyed and supply routes disrupted
Nairobi Stock Exchange loses $591 million in value on first day of trading
Tourism and agriculture industries face potential heavy losses due to unrest
51b9a2d46dac43952e713874a5769be5ae350626:
Ducati: Italian luxury motorbike manufacturer competes fiercely against Japanese mega-plants, driven by pride.

Bruce Dickinson: Iron Maiden lead singer trades leather-clad rockstar image for commercial airline pilot uniform.

Paul Van Dyk: Legendary trance musician and DJ draws inspiration from former East Berlin's war-weathered rhythms.
d670da295571f998bd0864540e2acd109d077131:
Michigan's primary sees Republican battle as main focus
Struggling auto industry impacts state's economy
Sen. John McCain campaigns to recreate New Hampshire success
Michigan a swing state with voting trends favoring Democrats
f2f2246150d06734b2fab694a39bd8d693c7d255: Search underway for missing pregnant Marine Lance Cpl. Maria Lauterbach last seen December 14 at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. Lauterbach's car found at Jacksonville bus station, cell phone discovered at Camp Lejeune's front gate. Lauterbach's mother reported her missing, said she was suspicious something bad happened. Lauterbach was to testify about witnessed incident at Camp Lejeune.
3cc0409612242093f34ea1d8ca1679f434955cff: Head of Iraq's main humanitarian group says the plight of Iraq's children is nearing epidemic proportions, with parents abandoning their children out of desperation. The Iraqi Red Crescent has the task of treating and feeding more than 1.6 million homeless children under the age of 12. The group gets some financial support from the central government and is negotiating with the U.S. Embassy for financial aid.
a67c4eaf797da7df18a715cd30c6cf11db96c954: Coalition forces discovered 26 bodies in mass graves and a "torture complex" with chains and an electrified bed near Muqdadiya, Iraq. The complex was believed to be an al Qaeda in Iraq haven and operating base. Troops found 24 people they said were terrorists and detained 37 suspects during the operation. Nine weapons caches were also destroyed.
58456413c8bd03a8ce70eb0061af07c6a9824fc3: Pakistan rejects U.N. nuclear watchdog chief's concerns about nuclear weapons falling into extremist hands. Foreign ministry spokesman calls Mohamed ElBaradei's comments "irresponsible" and "unwarranted". Pakistan stresses its nuclear weapons are "fully secure and under multilayered safeguards and controls". ElBaradei had expressed fears about Pakistan's nuclear weapons due to political instability in the country.
da040b67082b56436ccc8479a4e435cbf892a1f2:
Presidential candidates discuss foreign policy credentials after Bhutto assassination.
Clinton stresses her ties with Bhutto and calls the election crucial.
Obama's camp welcomes renewed talks on foreign policy and questions Clinton's Iraq war vote.
Candidates react to the gravity of the event and its potential impact on the Iowa caucuses.
c71748bb246a2b05e676862b75b38fa03bf6646e:
Lebanon's civil war memories resurface amid recent bombings and assassinations
Relative peace and reconstruction followed the war, but bombings and assassinations have returned
Presidential election and struggle between religion and clan threaten to set Lebanon back 20 years
Lebanon's political actors re-enact scenes from the final act of the civil war 19 years ago
800f8dc06596c30444526bf31dd0db7504391a82:
Seven Manchester United fans hospitalized after violence before Champions' League draw against Roma in Italy.

Five fans received stab wounds, two others treated for being drunk, none with serious injuries.

British Embassy warned fans not to use Pont Duca d'Aosta bridge due to presence of Roma's notorious Ultras.

Roma coach Luciano Spalletti condemned the violence, marking the second consecutive game between the teams marred by violence.
3b0ed227dc7e5292e302183282d8bbe23d7b1db2: Police are searching for Chester Stiles, suspected of raping a 3-year-old girl on videotape four years ago. The girl has been found safe and her mother is cooperating with authorities. Stiles' former girlfriend, Tina Allen, says she regrets introducing Stiles to the victim's family. Stiles is also being sought by the FBI for separate state charges of sexual assault and lewdness with a minor.
1e713005e16983f75222235967c0cbeb0b944f80: American al Qaeda member Adam Gadahn renounces US citizenship in a video, destroying his passport and protesting imprisonments. Gadahn references President Bush's Middle East trip, urging attacks against him. The video was produced after the Annapolis Conference in November. Gadahn is on the FBI's Most Wanted List with a $1 million reward for his capture.
360ae10bc8bd30a2aca7bc6b7000e138af63adb1: Theodore Sorensen, who helped draft John F. Kennedy's 1960 speech on Catholicism, compares it to Mitt Romney's recent speech on faith in politics. Sorensen says Kennedy's speech reassured reasonable people but did not eliminate anti-Catholicism. Romney's speech emphasized the role of religion in public life more than Kennedy's did. Sorensen believes Romney's speech will be viewed as successful.
50e996059a005d15e3e89b5a3c3695309671ed34: Boeing 777, a mainstay of long-haul fleets, has never been involved in a fatal accident since its service began in 1995. The aircraft family includes five commercial passenger models and a freighter version, making over two million flights. It set a world record for distance traveled non-stop by a commercial jetliner in 2005, flying 21,601 km from Hong Kong to London Heathrow. The 777's landing gear is the largest ever incorporated into a commercial aircraft
ccc7f6a2139593c47f6b5880f1e3eef9e7a69734: Donors pledge $7.4 billion to help build a Palestinian state at a conference in Paris. The conference focuses on short-term priorities for the Palestinians, particularly those living in Gaza. Palestinian Prime Minister Salam Fayyad calls the pledge of money a "vote of confidence" in the Palestinians. The World Bank praises a three-year reform plan prepared by the Palestinians but says it will only succeed if accompanied by donor aid and Israeli actions.
f4f90d4ff5af3e3648055673e040f0f43ae076d2: Rep. Tom Lantos, Democratic chairman of the House Committee on Foreign Affairs, dies at 80 due to cancer complications. Lantos, a Holocaust survivor, represented his Northern California district for 14 terms. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice called him "a true American hero." Lantos was the only Holocaust survivor to have served in Congress.
6c9ec6b9d3e936d2394f74354d577fdfcdd985a3: Three car bombs kill at least 27 people and wound 151 in the largely Shiite city of Amara, prompting a vehicle ban through Thursday. Additional security measures have been put in place in the city. Baghdad also hit by violence, with a car bomb killing five Iraqi civilians and wounding 15 others. Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki denounces the attack, calling it part of a conspiracy against the Iraqi people.
438a2046f4465fb1f6dab1cb327ef9ca86a4cc0d: Kenya's reputation as one of East Africa's most stable nations has been challenged by widespread poverty, violent crime, corruption, and ethnic tensions. The election pitched incumbent President Mwai Kibaki against opposition leader Raila Odinga, with Kibaki declared the winner. The result has been questioned by international election observers, causing doubt about the country's political future.
73818f6c987b3604b8bc92c4fb03bc68af196b77: Benazir Bhutto's assassination has led to mixed reactions from Pakistani women, who feel she conformed to feudal politics and didn't effectively challenge anti-female laws during her time in office. Despite this, there is hope for Pakistan, as demonstrated by the ability to publicly debate cruel laws against women. The country must now recall the vision of its founder, Muhammad Ali Jinnah, who advocated for religious freedom and equal partnership between men and women.
f06d91f46326752b02cdc48e8fa472dcc38a0846: Saudi King Abdullah pardons rape victim sentenced to 200 lashes and six months in prison. The case drew international attention and criticism over the treatment of women under Saudi Arabia's strict Islamic law. The king felt the pardon was in the best interests of the Saudi people. The White House welcomed the decision but stressed it was a matter for the Saudi Arabians and King Abdullah.
c54bee6384d58517757ad5a8a30ea6dc59980a07: Coroner dismisses former butler Paul Burrell's claims of knowing a secret about Princess Diana, stating the information was already public. Burrell's testimony in the inquest into Diana's death was delayed and contained discrepancies. Diana's former lawyer testified that the princess believed Queen Elizabeth planned to abdicate and a plot existed to injure her.
2757ff294ae08e977ed6a2b6e1854210f28f12c9: Princess Diana's former butler, Paul Burrell, testifies at her inquest, revealing that Diana's mother called her "a whore" for her relationships with Muslim men. Burrell doubts Diana was ready to marry Dodi Fayed, as she still cared for former boyfriend Hasnat Khan. The inquest aims to determine the cause of Diana and Fayed's deaths in a 1997 car crash.
6a004c991c482f664ab8ac78df0bda26860b1c7a: U.S., Turkish, and Iraqi leaders discuss Kurdish rebels using northern Iraq for attacks on Turkey. Turkish warplanes target Kurdish separatist locations in northern Iraq. Bush and Erdogan talk about combating PKK, a group considered a terrorist organization by the U.S. and EU. Iraqi Kurdish officials condemn the Turkish bombing campaign.
69159eadf4dcb2b7850f3a4db6454f8209f33e3a:
Top-seed Andy Roddick defeated Kei Nishikori 6-2 6-4 in the ATP tournament in San Jose.
James Blake overcame first-serve problems to beat Jesse Levine 6-4 6-4, advancing to the quarterfinals.
John Isner beat third-seeded German Tommy Haas 4-6 7-6 6-3, advancing to the quarterfinals.
Fifth-seeded Mardy Fish beat Germany's Denis
c6129a4c1fbd5680f512da18fb60a19a74f4959e: Several Marines under investigation for alleged intentional killing of civilians during 2004 Falluja offensive in Iraq. No charges filed yet, based on "credible allegations" from a former Marine. Naval Criminal Investigative Service conducting the probe. Allegations involve eight captured Iraqis gunned down after a firefight.
1fe7d16db2c7a742dc1bcf04bfb8e285e7909f03: At least 10 people have died and thousands left homeless due to torrential rains in Ecuador. Los Ríos province was the hardest hit, with five people dying in an ambulance accident. President Rafael Correa declared a state of emergency and allocated funds for emergency efforts and farmers. Ecuadorean Red Cross reports provinces along the Pacific coast are most affected, with drinking water shortages and evacuations.
e0ddf766661004eb3ff337d95e249073410f0755:
Italian tennis players Potito Starace and Daniele Bracciali banned for betting on matches.
Starace suspended for six weeks, fined $30,000; Bracciali banned for three months, fined $20,000.
Italian Tennis Federation calls penalties "absolutely, excessively severe."
Players claim they are scapegoats for larger match-fixing scandal.
dd37d70b837b24247e9abafe8fb5bc5fae5de464: Trevor Rees, the sole survivor of the crash that killed Princess Diana, testified that he still cannot remember the incident and does not support conspiracy theories surrounding it. Rees suffered serious injuries in the 1997 crash and received anonymous threats after the accident. He denied allegations by Mohamed al Fayed that British security services were behind the crash. Rees said he remembers nothing new about the crash and maintains it was an accident.
6e3028e9ae17ab59abc7732fe840468ac9dcb60c: Father and three children found after being stranded in snowy California woods for three days. The family lost their way while searching for a Christmas tree and sought shelter in a culvert. They spelled out "Help" with twigs on a nearby road, leading to their rescue by a helicopter.
24d2f15f65bfb5608c75d19ba07fc410aab4d9c6:
"No Country for Old Men" wins best picture at the 80th Academy Awards
Coen brothers win best director and best adapted screenplay
European actors sweep all four acting categories
"No Country" receives four awards in total, the most of any film
698329cc7a8d796d7635bf59d2435aa22c1a38e6:
Passenger's death on American Airlines flight highlights importance of taking precautions before flying
MedAire, Inc. advised 74 airlines on handling over 17,000 in-flight medical events last year
U.S. commercial airlines must carry automatic external defibrillators, oxygen, and medical kits by law
Hydration and moderation are key for passengers, along with carrying water, a snack, and critical medications
b531a8ba685e8d461d0a491f35c9970c3dddf3dd: President Bush signs energy bill to raise auto fuel economy standards for the first time in decades. The bill requires a corporate average of 35 miles per gallon by 2020. It also boosts federal support for alternative fuel research and energy conservation efforts. A Republican filibuster in the Senate removed provisions that would have eliminated tax breaks for oil companies and a requirement that electric utilities produce a portion of their power from alternative sources.
5b0e686b4679910743337ce02b36dd71a5caf5eb:
President Bush stresses role of faith-based groups in fighting AIDS
Bush asks Congress for additional $15 billion to continue and expand AIDS relief program
President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief has treated more than 1.3 million people with AIDS
Bush to visit sub-Saharan Africa early next year to see the program at work
980e6db610d9882443d61e36d955f02d983d3e76:
Oregon Supreme Court rules 12-year-old boy should have a say in circumcision decision.
Custody dispute between divorced parents centers around child's religious conversion and circumcision.
Father argues First Amendment right to practice faith, mother says procedure is invasive and irreversible.
Court sends case back to trial court to determine child's stance on circumcision.
6c18984d8f30ce196e9399200dd15e373e699267:
Man rescues co-worker from crocodile, accidentally shoots him
Both men were collecting crocodile eggs in Northern Territory, Australia
Jason Grant suffered injuries from crocodile bite and gunshot
Injuries not life-threatening, Grant flown to hospital for treatment
e00f05efe2038fffc8eaa1e8eecbe9445a9483e5:
Four active-duty U.S. soldiers, including three Army Rangers, arrested for planning to rob drug traffickers.

Soldiers charged with conspiracy to possess and distribute cocaine and carrying firearms in connection with the conspiracy.

ATF agents set up a sting operation, leading to arrests at a storage facility and an Army Ranger training center.

Soldiers face minimum mandatory sentences of 10 years in prison for drug conspiracy and an additional five years for weapons allegation.
9ce109dc50fe4eca8b2d0c926d5dbd1df5f49187: Armenian President declares state of emergency after clashes between police and protesters. Opposition supporters claim last month's presidential election was rigged. Authorities clear Freedom Square of demonstrators, leading to further protests in the city. Government hopes for a resolution through political dialogue and international community support.
bbec538b4453859ee9c772c4de8f0eb28acd87c4: Nearly 3 million gallons of sewage spilled into San Francisco Bay after a pump failure at a waste treatment facility in Mill Valley. The sewage and storm water was partially treated, and an alarm that would have alerted workers also failed. Boaters are being warned to avoid the Richardson Bay area, and residents are advised to avoid contact with the water. The California Department of Fish and Game has found no sign of sick or distressed wildlife resulting from the spill.
c4e0587d1b8fcc06c2cc5cfcec42a34d314fbe44: Massive anti-Mafia sweep spans from New York to Sicily, targeting Gambino, Genovese, and Bonanno families. 62 members face 80 charges, including money laundering, gambling, and murder. Gambino family profited from extortion in construction industry and labor unions. Key arrests made in New York, Long Island, and New Jersey, with additional arrests in Italy linked to Mafia boss Salvatore Lo Piccolo.
7eaaa5bfe35344ee85eeb871a4d31cd31b12965b: Saddam Hussein faked having WMDs to deter Iran from attacking Iraq, according to FBI agent George Piro. Hussein didn't anticipate the US would invade over WMD claims. He believed a strong, defiant image would prevent Iranian invasion. After capture, Hussein expressed pride in evading US authorities for nine months.
9cce7373a54faccf5b5d1232c82afab9b29ab6b9:
Nancy Grace introduces her twins on set
The twins go out for a stroll
The twins reach 3 months old
First video of Nancy Grace's twins released
1b37e549bbcec859711e5b2ef310e94deed4dc95:
Hispanics described as largest minority group in the U.S., but labels belie complexity
Terms "Hispanic" and "Latino" seen as too limiting, failing to capture diversity within group
Census defines Hispanic or Latino origin as Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban or "other Spanish, Hispanic or Latino"
Some argue broader terms used by media and politicians overlook individual identities and cultures
da780ee614304d195bde3b7549313c02990d072e: U.S. Navy moves guided-missile destroyer USS Cole and other ships to eastern Mediterranean Sea off Lebanon amid political standoff over the country's presidency. The deployment signals U.S. engagement and concern for stability in the region, but the Navy would not confirm if the events are linked. Lebanon has been without a president since November and the upcoming parliamentary vote on a new president was postponed for a 15th time earlier this week.
e24cdc200182d698a34f564ba71f4948ce6760e5: Hillary Clinton claimed victory in Texas, Ohio, and Rhode Island primaries, boosting her campaign. Barack Obama won the Vermont primary and maintained a similar delegate lead. John McCain became the presumptive GOP nominee after winning all four Republican contests. Mike Huckabee dropped out of the Republican race following the results.
42483672c204aebcf7ba6e7d6ca4c628fe9a69e7: Top three Democratic presidential candidates face off in a debate in South Carolina, with the hearts and minds of African-American voters on the line. A CNN/Opinion Research Corp. poll released Friday suggested that nearly 60 percent of black registered Democrats were backing Obama. Obama's lead over Clinton among black men is more than 50 points, and among black women, once a Clinton stronghold, Obama has an 11-point advantage.
3501c83d3dab4a2e4d2142522a4bf1510a64422a: Pakistan's President Pervez Musharraf blamed former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto for her own assassination. Bhutto was killed while standing in an armored moving car after rallying supporters for parliamentary elections. Musharraf said he welcomes an international investigation into her death. He also discussed the hunt for al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden, saying there is no proof he is in Pakistan.
964589248c2d95ac3c734ad71283ca22ae4ecedf:
Texas couple charged with capital murder in "Baby Grace" case
Riley Ann Sawyers, 2, was beaten to death and dumped in Galveston Bay
Couple initially charged with injury to a child and tampering with evidence
Grand jury upgraded charges after hearing testimony and reviewing evidence
6b72550a663bcb7a64e242ede6da53b1f585ea71:
Saudi lawyer's license reinstated after representing rape victim
Protest in India against Saudi sentence for rape victim
Lawyer Abdul Rahman al-Lahem had license revoked for speaking to media
Victim sentenced to 200 lashes and six months in prison for being alone with unrelated man
c96bdfc0463d994ddc858ad358fe59371be79352: CNN's "Eye on Russia" series showcases photos and stories from Russia, highlighting its beauty and challenges. Russians and foreigners share their experiences, noting the country's astonishing churches, palaces, and scenery. The series also touches on the gap between rich and poor and the country's ongoing journey towards democracy.
085dc5d706487da983655043b144952956cb3c5b: FBI and DHS issue bulletin citing alleged al Qaeda claim of responsibility for Bhutto's assassination. Italian news agency reports al Qaeda No. 2 Ayman al-Zawahiri began planning in October. Claim not found on regular Islamist Web sites. U.S. intelligence community monitoring situation, trying to determine responsibility.
1c1dc1da2f6ba045478e25e91c8e1b039ce4cc67:
U.S. Senate called to order for 11 seconds in political scuffle
Democratic senators hold short "pro forma" sessions to prevent recess appointments
President Bush declines deal to make dozens of appointments in exchange for not appointing Steven Bradbury
Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid refuses to approve Bradbury due to concerns over interrogation techniques
da90eb668bfc66a5e70b2e6631a5ec1c9ffb2413:
President Bush proposes temporary tax relief package to boost economy
Package should be 1% of GDP, around $140 billion, with tax incentives for businesses
Democrats demand relief for low and middle-income earners in the package
Bush urges Congress to make existing income tax cuts permanent
717b1934db9eb0d7e5e2aef75cd54b29a6530a59: Over 150 people abandoned sinking cruise liner Explorer after collision with iceberg in Antarctic waters. Distress call sent around 10 p.m. ET Thursday near South Shetland Islands. Norwegian rescue ship arrived at scene, passengers and crew evacuated onto lifeboats. Captain and first officer stayed on board.
e493fe7f282adb10c6b9af18d41f0181f17341e5: Todd Barber witnesses rapid destruction of Cayman Island coral reef, dedicates life to restoring ocean reef ecosystems. Establishes The Reef Ball Foundation in 1993 to manufacture and place Reef Balls in marine habitats worldwide. Reef Balls are circular, concrete structures that serve as base habitat for natural reef growth. Foundation has placed Reef Balls in over 59 countries, aims to conserve marine resources and change behaviors.
